overview:
Earning her undergraduate and master’s degrees in computer science at Stanford, Mauria began her ecommerce career as a product manager during the early days of Netscape.

Throughout her 15+ year career, she’s held leadership positions and handled major product and social media initiatives at leading technology companies all over Silicon Valley, including AOL, Good Technology, PayPal and eBay.

She also spent 3+ years on the board of SayNow, a social voice start-up that was recently acquired by Google.

In the fall of 2010, she left eBay to follow her entrepreneurial dream and start her own company. Remembering how exhilarating and exhausting it was to be a first-time mom, her vision was to create an ecommerce-meets-social experience that could make parents’ lives easier and help them make healthy product choices for their families. And that’s how Citrus Lane came to be.
